title: Didone used by Clarins
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/image_6189.jpg)
  
Source: Clarins Men Baume Super Hydratant
author: Quadrato

comments.content:
Similar to Freight Display Light

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FreightDispLightAsBaumeSupergyk_5722.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/garagefonts/freight-disp-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025010/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/garagefonts/freight-disp-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/garagefonts/freight-disp-pro/")  
except for the ball shaped ear on \_g\_ and leg on \_k\_.  
Perhaps custom?  
Don

Your sample is too distorted to get an accurate ID.

The packaging appears to use Walbaum, which is similar to your sample but not, I think, a match:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025010/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum/")
Clarins uses a bespoke typeface designed by Jean-François Rappo.

As seen on [Clarins.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025010/http:/www.clarins.com/) and simply called 'Clarins'

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202015-02-08%20at%2015_4037.14.42.png)
Thanks a lot for your help!
